name: Jackfruit
climate: Jackfruit thrives in tropical climates with warm temperatures.
It requires a frost-free environment to ensure optimal growth.
High humidity levels are beneficial for jackfruit cultivation.
Subtropical regions can also support jackfruit trees if winters are mild.
sunlight: Jackfruit trees need full sun exposure to grow and produce fruit.
They should receive at least six to eight hours of direct sunlight daily.
Insufficient sunlight can result in poor fruit development and growth.
Planting jackfruit in shaded areas can hinder its overall health.
watering: Regular watering is essential for young jackfruit trees to establish roots.
Mature trees are drought-tolerant but still require occasional watering.
Overwatering can lead to root rot; ensure good drainage in soil.
During dry periods, increase watering frequency to maintain soil moisture.
soil: Jackfruit prefers deep, fertile, and well-drained loamy soils for best growth.
A soil pH range of 6.0 to 7.5 is ideal for jackfruit cultivation.
Avoid heavy clay soils which can hinder root development and growth.
Adding organic matter like compost enhances soil fertility and structure.
extra_care_tip: Prune jackfruit trees regularly to remove dead branches and maintain shape.
Mulching around the base helps retain soil moisture and suppress weeds.
